description: When trying to execute code that uses Global state, a compile/runtime error is thrown due to a problem with the DefaultDict. The DefaultDict is not properly defined in the Global state, causing the code to fail when trying to access it.
code:
from collections import defaultdict

# Create an empty defaultdict
d = defaultdict(list)

# Add some values to the defaultdict
d['a'].append(1)
d['b'].append(2)
d['b'].append
